Header: Infantry Officers in Pakistan Army Calls on Commander of the Army
Content: A four-member delegation of high-ranking military officers of the Pakistan Army, headed by Major General Abid Rafique, Director General Infantry of Pakistan Army called on the Commander of the Army Lieutenant General Mahesh Senanayake at the Army Headquarters, on Saturday (1). With the blessings of the Commander, the Pakistan Army delegation has been invited to Sri Lanka by Major General Duminda Keppetiwalana, Director General Infantry at the Army Headquarters with the objective of learning and sharing knowledge on infantry. During the interaction with the Commander of the Army, the group exchanged views on matters of relevance to both organizations and military studies, etc. Exchange of goodwill mementos also took place during the meet. The delegation arrived in Sri Lanka on Saturday (31). Major General Aruna Wanniarachchi, Director General Training and Major General Duminda Keppetiwalana, Director General Infantry were associated with the Commanderâ€™s meet at the office.
